result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time.
Complete a Psycho-Sexual evaluation and comply with any sex offender treatment recommendations, if recommended.

No contact direct or indirect with Z.S.P. or her family.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision including both alcohol and controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.
All prescriptions to be filled at one pharmacy.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications, pharmacies and treatment.
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the DOC.
Provide DNA sample if not already completed.

10:51 a.m. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in court with attorney Frances Reynolds Colbert. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Decision for post-conviction motion for a breach of a plea agreement that was heard on May 9, 2017. Court is prepared to give its decision today. Court reads in part from  the sentencing transcript and case law. 
BY THE COURT: Motion for post-conviction relief is Denied. Court didn't find a breach of the plea agreement and did not find ineffective counsel of Atty Kryshak. Court will not grant withdraw of plea or resentencing.
Additional Documents for the Petition for Sentence adjustment
Second Motion for Extension of Time to Allow Circuit Court to Rule on Defendant's Post Conviction Motion
Decision on May 17, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Kevin M. Williams in court with attorney Frances Reynolds Colbert. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:28 pm  Atty Knaapen calls the case and states the appearances.
This is set for a post-conviction motion today.

Atty Colbert makes statements to the Court.
Court reviews the file.
Court questions Atty Knaapen.
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.

G. Kryshak is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Colbert.
Cross examination by Atty Knaapen.
Re-direct examination by Atty Colbert.
Re-cross examination by Atty Knaapen.
Witness is excused.

Atty Colbert makes final arguments to the Court.
Atty Knaapen makes final arguments to the Court.
Atty Colbert does not have any further arguments.

BY THE COURT:
Court wants to re-read the sentencing transcript and will make his decision within 10 days.

Atty Colbert makes statements to the Court re: she and Defendant will appear in person for the Decision hearing.
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court.
  Decision scheduled for May 17, 2017 at 10:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Portage County Jail - Inmate General Request Form

Defendant Kevin M. Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-381 and 15CF-20.

10:14 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Defendant did enter pleas previously.
Court did order a PSI. Copies were forwarded to counsel.
Atty Knaapen has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty Kryshak states a correction.

Atty Kryshak has no witnesses that he will be calling.
State has complied with victim statute notifications.

Court did receive and read the victim impact statements.
Defense has also read the victim impact statements.

10:17 AM C.P. addresses the Court, makes statement, father of victim.
10:21 AM J.S. addresses the Court, makes statement, mother of victim.
10:27 AM Victim addresses the Court, makes statement.
Court thanks Victim for being here this morning.

State has no further impact statements.

10:31 AM Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, 521 days jail credit.
10:38 AM Atty Kryshak addresses the Court prior to sentencing, requests the Court to go along with the State's recommendation.
10:44 AM Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Kryshak hands to Court a note from the Jail. State has read the note. Jail staff has had no problems with Defendant's lengthly confinement.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-381:
Prison Sentence for a period of 7 Years
Initial Confinement of 3 Years
Extended Supervision of 4 Years
521 Days Credit 
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for earned release program
Conditions:
No contact direct or indirect with Z.S.P. or her family
Comply with the WI Sex Offender Registry
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision including both alcohol and controlled substances
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
All prescriptions to be filld at one pharmacy
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications, pharmacies and treatment
Complete a psychosexual evaluation and comply with any sex offender treatment recommendations if recommended
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the DOC
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Provide DNA sample if not already completed
Pay court costs
Pay DNA surcharge

15CF-20:
Prison Sentence for a period of 3 Years
Initial Confinement of 1.5 Years
Extended Supervision of 1.5 Years
521 Days Credit 
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for earned release program
Concurrent to 14CF-381
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-381
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Parties will keep their copy of the PSI, are to be kept confidential.

Appeal rights are addressed.

11:08 AM Court is in recess.
Sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 10:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 02-26-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Kevin M. Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF381 and 15CF20.

10:34 a.m.  Amended Information provided by Atty Knaapen on both files.
10:36 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Jury Trial scheduled for 12/16/15 cancelled and a plea has been reached.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Kryshak has recieved the Amended Information and waives reading.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF381:
Count 1 - No contest

15CF20:
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Atty Kryshak indicates that there is an error on the plea questionnaire and states on the record.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification had been complied with by the State.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty in 14CF381, Count 1 and 15CF20, Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
PSI Ordered.
PSI to be completed by 2/19/16 and provided to counsel prior to sentencing.
Bond revoked.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 12-14-2015 10:30 am
Status conference at 09-25-2015 11:00 am
Jury trial at 12-16-2015 08:30 am

6/8/15   Cash bond amended from $50,000 to $5,000.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober. Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Z.S.P, or where she resides or is temporarily occupying. Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *Seven times per week, on a daily basis*

Defendant Kevin M. Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:34 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a notice of motion and motion at this time.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, requests the bond be reduced.  Atty Kryshak received the information 2 to 3 weeks ago.  Atty Kryshak states there is no use of force.

This case was bumped, is not going to be tried this week.  Court has another matter, 2013 civil case. Court made the decision to have the civil litigants their day in Court, 3 day trial. 

There have been previous bond modification bond hearings.

Parties take a moment to reschedule the jury trial.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, requests bond modification, for the record.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, replies.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, replies.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, replies.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine bond modification.

State has complied with victim notification statutes with regards to today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court modifies the bond to $5,000 cash.

Atty Kryshak addresses 15CF-20, requests that the bond in that case be amended, as stated on the record.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, replies to the bond in 15CF-20.

BY THE COURT:
Court modifies the bond in 15CF-20, to a $500 cash bond with same conditions in 14CF-381.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Defendant dated 4/7/15
Jury trial at 06-10-2015 08:00 am
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

8:47 a.m. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Kevin M. Williams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion for Bond Modification is heard today and Motion for Discovery.
Atty Kryshak states the reasons for the motion and reduce to $5,000 cash bond and order audio/video materials or medical records or test results be provided to Defense.
ADA Knaapen address the Discovery Motion.
Court questions Atty Kryshak.
Atty Kryshak specifies the reasons.
ADA Knaapen states he has provided what the State  has in their files.

BY THE COURT:  If there are recorded statements and/or information from sexual assualt kit, then the State has within 10 days of today to provide to Defense.

ADA Knaapen addresses and states objections to the Motion for Bond Modification.
Atty Kryshak makes statements in support of the Motion for Bond Modification to reduce down to $5,000.00 cash bond.

BY THE COURT: Motion denied and Bond remains the same.
Bail/Bond Review on February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
